description: Time from study entry to event or censoring
Status indicating whether the event of interest occurred
notes: 0 = censored (event did not occur during follow-up), 1 = event occurred
Three treatment groups: A (standard), B (experimental), C (control)

description: Patients were recruited from clinical trial database between 2020-2022
Baseline measurements were taken at study entry (day 0)
Follow-up data collected every 3 months for up to 5 years
Events were confirmed by clinical review committee
Censoring occurred when patients were lost to follow-up or reached study end

variable_name: - All continuous variables were checked for outliers (±3 SD)
- Missing data: <1% of values (handled by complete case analysis)
- Event verification: 100% of events reviewed by independent committee
- Data validation: Automated checks run weekly during collection period
- Age may confound treatment effects (older patients may have worse outcomes)
- Biomarker levels may be affected by treatment type
- Gender distribution should be checked across treatment groups
- Proportional hazards assumption should be tested for each covariate
- Consider stratified analysis if proportional hazards violated
- Model selection: forward/backward selection or penalized regression may be used
